channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big Tech's AI Race Has One Main Winner: Nvidia
item.description: Amazon joins Microsoft and Google in blowout capital spending with mixed business results, while Intel posted disappointing second-quarter results.

item.title: Stock market bulls are dangerously close to losing control to the bears
Is Trump Really Better Than Harris for Oil and Gas Investors?
item.description: The former president wants the U.S. to “drill, baby, drill,” while Vice President Kamala Harris doesn’t. But figuring out which one is more favorable to the industry is tricky.

item.title: ‘She makes seriously irresponsible choices’: We secretly transfer 20% of our 17-year-old daughter’s paycheck to a Roth IRA. Is this illegal?
item.description: “She spends all her money whenever she gets paid.”

item.title: The Stock That Took Investors on a $90 Billion Ride
item.description: QXO, backed by Jared Kushner, lost $90 billion in market value, but the only rule broken was the Law of One Price.

item.title: Here’s the dividend-paying stock playbook for Fed rate cuts
item.description: Bad news is bad news again. Time to consider defensive dividend payers

item.title: Japanese Stocks Suffer Biggest Fall Since 2020 on Economic Concerns
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average posted its largest single-day drop in more than four years, driven down by signs of cooling in the U.S. economy and an interest-rate increase by the Bank of Japan.

item.title: Echoes of the dot-com bubble haunt U.S. stocks in 2024. Why investors shouldn’t worry too much about it.
item.description: Jeremy Grantham’s GMO said it doesn’t make sense to draw a parallel between today’s so-called Magnificent Seven and their equivalents during the boom-and-bust cycle in the late-1990s.

item.title: Weak Economic Data Prompts Stock Selloff
item.description: Yield on 10-year Treasury note slides below 4% while drugmaker Moderna’s shares take a dive on Thursday.

item.title: I retired comfortably on $100,000, so it’s not a myth – if you can handle the risk
item.description: A reader challenges the argument that you can’t have a happy retirement with a small nest egg
